author: seamonkey82
content: I made some edits to the besu launch commands on the hackmd guide.  All of them had `--rpc-http-api` without `--rpc-http-enabled`, which doesn't happen by default, and they all include the `MINER` api which isn't necessary and will cause besu to fail to launch without also including `--miner-coinbase` and `--miner-enabled`.

author: seamonkey82
content: For nimbus, I removed the rpc-http flags entirely since it can only use rpc-ws anyhow, and I removed `MINER` from the `--rpc-ws-api` flags.

author: seamonkey82
content: That said, I've still been unsuccessful at getting nimbus-besu to sync past slot 1219.

author: seamonkey82
content: Um... just tried to start a fresh instance of besu without any of the mining flags and it's insisting on a coinbase.  Perhaps I jumped the gun and it only allows these flags to be omitted after the merge block has been reached.

author: seamonkey82
content:
` WARN  | Besu | --miner-coinbase has been ignored because --miner-enabled was not defined on the command line.`

Okay, that definitely seems like a bug.  It won't do an initial launch without `--miner-coinbase` but it ignores it and proceeds because `--miner-enabled` wasn't passed.
